Posts.Content: My husband has Lymphoma. He was fainting,dizzy and hurt himself several times during chemo. He was on a high dose of Prednisone. He was on no hormones. His problem was dehydration. And trying to get him to drink more water was not easy. I am NOT suggesting your husband drink more water. I would never diagnose. But it might be a good idea to discuss this with his dr. Only he can say if your husband need more hydration.
Posts.Signature: His fight is over. How brave he was. 47 years of love.
Posts.Title: Dizziness

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear of all that has happened but admire your positivity. Being together is the most important thing of all. But the Patriots?????? Really? lol Go Jaguars! (Some day!) Wishing you and yours a wonderful Christmas!

Posts.Title: Surgical Castration done, 5 days later still having frequent urinations

Posts.Content: I do not know anything about Prostate cancer but do experience bladder spasms especially after a BM (blush). Very often, the spasm is not a spasm but a bladder infection. Perhaps you should him to the hospital to be checked for that? Like Insaid, I know next to nothing about Prostate cancer. But being a diabetic, I am prone to infections. They hurt so bad. But I do have spasms also and they feel like infections. I hope you don't mind me posting here. I usually post on the Lymphoma forum because that is what my husband has. But I do emphasize with your husband. Spasms and infections really really hurt.
Posts.Signature: His fight is over. How brave he was. 47 years of love.
Posts.Title: Any suggestions for bladder spasms?

Posts.Content: Sorry I can't help but no one here will ever laugh at you. What kind of cancer do you have? That might help get you some replies. Or talk to your dr.
Posts.Signature: His fight is over. How brave he was. 47 years of love.
Posts.Title: What's the opposite of shortening?

Posts.Content: Long story short, we were in a real financial crunch when my husband was diagnosed with Lymphoma. We had a very high bill at the Mayo because of my knee and hip issues and surgeries. I could not get my husband in the Mayo so we had to go to another hospital which turned out to be a blessing in disguise. I called Financial Assistance and they had me come in with seven documents. To my delight, we qualified. The Charity covered everything our insurance didn't for a year. When I applied the next year, we again qualified. This time we were not accepted but the Financial Advisor told me it might help to write a hardship letter. It was hard to do but I did it. We were again accepted. It was a God send,truly. I did not apply the year because we are doing a little better. I had to go to the Mayo financial assistance. They were NOT nice to me but agreed to wipe out the bill. Another God send. We were so grateful to God. So, you might want to talk to Financial Assistance at your hospital.
Posts.Signature: His fight is over. How brave he was. 47 years of love.
